website_summaries.verdict: The Music Hall MMF-5's high-style flair and impressive features are surpassed only by its sumptuous sound.
pros: record clamp secures LPs to the platter
cons: You have to remove the platter to change the speed from 33.3rpm to 45rpm
audiophile quality comes with an audiophile price

customer_reviews.title: that if your truly serious about getting back into vinyl you will need to spend some money for a good turntable. Before I bought
customer_reviews.text: I found out after some trial and error, that if your truly serious about getting back into vinyl you will need to spend some money for a good turntable. Before I bought this music hall, I had 2 different audio tchnica tables. Well I ended up selling them on Gaigslist. Music Hall even has a video on you tube that will truly simplify setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome turntable!  Just be sure you take the time to set it up properly.
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a turntable as nice as this one in my entire life. Plays beautifully. One caveat - you have to set it up property. Mine wasn't at first. Music wasn't sounding quite right. I went back and double-checked by going through the steps and watching the YouTube video on this turntable. After setting it up "properly", it sounds majestic!
customer_reviews.author: David W. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Check your turntable upon receiving it!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to check the entire item. Mine was visibly not new as it had a fair-sized dent on the left side and there was a scrape on the dust cover even though the packaging itself had no damage to it at all. Returned and not planning to get another turntable from Music Hall anymore. Overall, it is a solid turntable. But for the price you pay, they should be checking and sending the item as "new" and not a "slightly used item".
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tong

customer_reviews.title: Music Hall 5.1 turntable
customer_reviews.text: Quite pleased with built quality- especially with bubble level. set the tonearm according to manual, but for some reason the body of the shell sometimes slightly touching the LP- i have to fix it, but for now don't know how.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander N

customer_reviews.title: He really liked the balance feature and says how nice it
customer_reviews.text: Still in box, was husband's Christmas gift. we are moving so that is why, He really liked the balance feature and says how nice it is
customer_reviews.author: S. Neel

customer_reviews.title: Technically Great and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful quality. I just wish there was an auto shut-off, so that the needle retracted when the side was over and i would not run for days, if i forget about the turntable running....
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Vroom

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed amazon two types of these turntables are listed, one without a glass platter or a goldring 2000 cartridge and the other with these items, I ordered the turntable with the glass platter and a goldring cartridge but received the other table.
customer_reviews.author: Don B. Maynard / EMC

customer_reviews.title: MUSIC TO MY EARS
customer_reviews.text: THE MUSIC HALL TURNTABLE I JUST PURCHASED IS JUST FANTASTIC. I'VE GOT ALL MY OLD ALBUMS FROM THE 60'S AND 70'S AND I NEVER HEARD SUCH GOOD SOUNDS. A CD CANNOT COMPARE THE GOOD SOUNDS. I'M RELIVING THE BEGINNING OF ROCK AND ROLL. WILL TRY TO BUY ALL LP ALBUMS ON AMAZON. LOCOMOTIVEMAN
customer_reviews.author: LOCOMOTIVE MAN

customer_reviews.title: Music Hall MMF 5.1
customer_reviews.text: Was really torn between this table and the Rega RP3. I am very happy I bought this table, Sounds great right out of the box. Easy to set up, great arm and the Music Hall cartridge sounds really good for the money. Lots of value here! Will consider a speed box and Denon DL103r as future upgrades. A happy analog camper!
customer_reviews.author: John W Graham

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: This isn't the actual item for sale.
customer_reviews.text: I was robbed on this transaction. This item has the old Goldring 1012 cartridge ($225) rather than the current-spec Magic Hall Magic 3 Mojo Cartridge ($350). There may be other differences, but this is the one that's indefensible. The price I paid is the full price available anywhere on the internet for the current version. The item I received (the older model) is going for $175 less everywhere. I essentially paid full price for a 2013 Lexus and got a 2011 model.
customer_reviews.author: jffielde

customer_reviews.title: Great turntable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very knowledgeable about turntables, but I bought one of these from Crutchfield to satisfy my inner turntable thing and I've been very happy with it. Setup was a breeze, gave me an excuse to start collecting my favorites on vinyl. I just run it through an NAD preamp and my Alienware, so it's not a pure analog operation, but it's still something fun to mess around with. Totally inexpert comment, but it's a really beautiful piece of equipment. Sleek.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent table when upgraded
customer_reviews.text: Excellent table. Add the acrylic platter, isolation platform, and a falcon psu Speedbox with a roadrunner tach and you have a very respectable table without spending 5k😎
customer_reviews.author: Jake Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this turntable for quite a few years and spent some money on an upgrade cartridge "goldring 1012gx" and for the price you cannot beat it. I have played it through my own monoblock tube amps I have built and it is the best. I also have hooked it up to a typical home stereo by sony in my entertainment room and it sounded spectacular there as well. MusicHall makes absolutely great products for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Action

customer_reviews.title: Moly Holy, It's a Great Turntable
customer_reviews.text: Music Hall MMF 5.1 Turntable....... Absolutely Beautiful...... Put an Audio Technica AT120-E cartridge on it and you have...... Analog Heaven!!! I Need Not Say More.... It's worth the money if you know what your doing. Gerard Masters
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Masters

customer_reviews.title: Best turntable under a $1000
customer_reviews.text: For the price out of the box it can not be beat it is a great turntable for under 1000
customer_reviews.author: Warren

product_meta.title: mmf 5.1 Black Record Turntable
product_meta.description: How you improve upon a Stereophile "Recommended Component" and The Absolute Sound "Editors' Choice Award" Winner? Ask Music Hall's Roy Hall. Roy quietly crafted an improved version of Music Hall's best-selling, brilliantly designed MMF-5 turntable. He spent many hours working out the fine details of the latest MMF-5.1 to offer an even a greater value for money than the MMF-5. Or, as he is fond of saying, "a greater value for a little more money." Little energy was expended on the name, Roy admits. But, what's in a name, when the performance is this outstanding? The MMF-5.1 includes the advanced and ultra-rigid M7 tonearm, a dynamically balanced alloy platter, and a $ Goldring MM cartridge. Plus, lots of other extras, too. The MMF-5.1 boasts a unique proprietary two-plinth design with six rubber springs separating the bottom platform from the top. This extra level of isolation keeps motor and room vibration out of your music. The compliant feet, two-speed synchronous motor, switch, wiring, and electrical parts are located on the bottom plinth, while the critical sound reproducing components such as the bearing and arm, are mounted on the "floating" top platform. A new feature for the MMF-5.1 is a dynamically balanced alloy platter. The platter and felt mat sit on a high quality, stainless steel ball bearing sheathed in Teflon, providing extra damping control for fluid, noise-free operation. The bearing assembly comes pre-charged with lubricant. The effective length of the tonearm is 9 inches, which allows a very shallow tracking arc for reduced distortion. The net effect is transparent sound and excellent realism, especially on acoustic instruments.
feature_bullets: Music Hall's unique dual plinth construction
Flexible internal tonearm wire drawn from high purity copper
Counterweight's center of gravity is level with the stylus tip
Music Hall Magic 3 moving magnet phono cartridge
